meanings.definition: A mark or series of marks left by the passage of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: I followed the tracks in the snow to find my lost dog.
meanings.sent2: The detective examined the tracks left at the crime scene.
meanings.sent3: The tracks in the mud led to a surprise birthday party.
meanings.sent4: Her footsteps left tracks of happiness wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The tracks of the car in the sand revealed its path.

meanings.definition: A path or trail made by the passage of people or animals.
meanings.sent1: The deer left tracks in the forest as it moved silently.
meanings.sent2: Hiking enthusiasts enjoy exploring new tracks in the wilderness.
meanings.sent3: The tracks through the park were filled with colorful flowers.
meanings.sent4: The tracks of the marathon runners stretched for miles.
meanings.sent5: The tracks in the snow guided us back to the cabin.

meanings.definition: A pair of parallel metal rails on which trains run.
meanings.sent1: The train conductor checked the tracks before departure.
meanings.sent2: The maintenance crew repaired the damaged tracks quickly.
meanings.sent3: The tracks gleamed under the bright sun like silver ribbons.
meanings.sent4: The tracks hummed with the rhythm of passing trains.
meanings.sent5: The tracks stretched into the distance, disappearing into the horizon.

meanings.definition: A song or piece of music on a recording.
meanings.sent1: She played her favorite tracks on the stereo during the road trip.
meanings.sent2: The DJ mixed different tracks seamlessly at the party.
meanings.sent3: The tracks on the album told a story of love and loss.
meanings.sent4: His tracks echoed through the room, filling it with melody.
meanings.sent5: The tracks on the CD brought back memories of summer days.
